channel.title: Need some advice (MineCraft)
channel.description:
Alright, first time on survival mode on my own on Minecraft, I've build an in-cave shelter torches, crafting benches etc etc. I actually struck gold before, in my in-cave house I found as I dug deeper and deeper using more and more torches I found more and more coal, I'm on something like 50 coal now for my first night.
I've made a pit fall outside the exit and covered it with dirt and torches. Now, what should I do? My plan was too extend through the front off it and create a rock house and wall off a route to some critical resources, Lumber etc..
Opinions? The only exit in/out is through the front which is covered with 2 hatch layers of dirt and torches at night.
And on another note, It was morning and I'm next too a dark cave, is it normal to see them all walking back in to it. I got attacked in daylight, luckily he attacked me and then punched my torch outside and set on fire, saved by the torch. I really want to clear out the cave but I've never attacked one of these zombies, I have more than enough torches to light the entire thing up.
Sorry because it's so long. I know there is some Minecraft players in this community so it would be nice if you could respond.
tl;dr people :
Go away

item.title: Need some advice (MineCraft)
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

I made a wooden home with a fort above, that way if creepers etc are at my front door, i can go to top and go out the back…
Iv done alot of things but i don’t play it anymore, it kinda bores me now.

You should make some sticks and then get string from spiders, to make a bow which makes it easier for you to kill skeletons, zombies etc.

Zombies are the easest of them all btw.
